# Project Overview

.pull-left[
### ğŸ” Research Topic
Interstate waste flows into Pennsylvania: how much trash PA imports, who sends it (especially NJ), and what that means for PA's landfill capacity.
]

.pull-right[
### ğŸ¯ Purpose
- Quantify PA imports (tons + origin states)
- Explain NJ's dominance in PA-bound waste
- Identify hotspot counties/facilities receiving imports
- Evaluate capacity risk
]

# Implications

.pull-left[
### ğŸ‘¥ Stakeholders
- **PA DEP / state policymakers:** monitor high-pressure counties and plan for import shocks (especially NJ)
- **Landfill operators & haulers:** diversify contracts and build contingency plans around top receiving sites
]

.pull-right[
### ğŸŒ Ethical & Societal
- **Long-run sustainability:** avoid short-term revenue incentives that encourage overreliance on out-of-state waste
- **Environmental burden & fairness:** import-heavy counties may face more truck traffic, odors, noise, and emissions â€” ensure impacted communities share benefits
]

---

# Implications *(continued)*

### âš–ï¸ Legal & Governance
- **Interstate waste rules:** imports are legal under interstate commerce â€” policy levers are mainly fees, reporting, and permitting, not outright bans
